titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Henry J. Tunis, was a sergeant in Company G, First Infantry Regiment, South Dakota Volunteers. Tunis mustered in as a private in May of 1898 and traveled to the Philippines aboard the Pacific Mail steamer City of Rio de Janiero. Tunis was mustered out in October of 1899.

scopecontent.p: Diary of Henry J. Tunis of Mitchell, S.D. during his service with Company G of the 1st South Dakota United States Volunteers, May 16, 1898 - October 16, 1899. The diary describes his service from his enlistment in the US Volunteers in May, 1889, to his training in California, shipping out of San Francisco in July 1898, arrival in the Philippines, descriptions of Manila and its population, daily duties in camp, guard duty, and skirmishes and battles, and finally leaving for home in August of 1899 and being mustered out of the service in Oct. 1899.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
